author: pawandhananjay
content:
Lighthouse doesn't directly distinguish between peers that are connected to one vs many subnets. 
While doing discovery, we ask discv5 to return some number of nodes that are in the required subnet(s) and then dial all of them.
We enforce that we do not disconnect from these subnet peers from our end (because of bad scoring) until after the attestation duty has passed.
As long as the peers that are subscribed to fewer subnets maintain a healthy score after the duty has passed, we don't kick them. 
We also cache recently seen enrs so that we can directly dial them without doing another discovery search.
